meanings.definition: Not consisting of two or more separate elements
meanings.sent1: The simple, noncompound solution worked best for the problem.
meanings.sent2: The noncompound structure of the molecule made it easy to analyze.
meanings.sent3: The noncompound ingredients in the recipe made it a breeze to follow.
meanings.sent4: Her noncompound approach to painting created a striking effect on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The noncompound design of the building stood out among the complex structures.

meanings.definition: Not formed by combining two or more separate elements
meanings.sent1: The noncompound material was easy to mold into different shapes.
meanings.sent2: The artist preferred using noncompound colors for a more natural look.
meanings.sent3: The noncompound puzzle pieces were easier for the children to assemble.
meanings.sent4: His noncompound explanation of the theory made it easier to understand.
meanings.sent5: The noncompound sound of the instrument was soothing to the ears.

meanings.definition: Not a compound word or phrase
meanings.sent1: The noncompound term was easy to define without breaking it down.
meanings.sent2: She chose to use noncompound words in her poetry for clarity.
meanings.sent3: The noncompound title of the book caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: His noncompound speech was direct and to the point.
meanings.sent5: The noncompound name of the company was memorable and unique.
